member.name: T:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.BitHelper.BitAggregateMagic
member.summary: The Aggregate Magic Algorithms adapted from @ http://aggregate.org/MAGIC/

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.BitHelper.BitAggregateMagic.CountOneBits(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Counts the number of set bits in .
member.param: The target for which to count the number of set bits.
member.returns: The number of set bits in .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.BitHelper.BitAggregateMagic.CountLeadingZeros(System.Int64)
member.summary: Counts the number of leading zeros.
member.param: The target for which to count the number of leading zeros.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.BitHelper.BitAggregateMagic.CountTrailingZeros(System.Int64)
member.summary: Counts the number of trailing zeros.
member.param: The target for which to count the number of trailing zeros.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.BitHelper.BitAggregateMagic.NextLargestPowerOf2(System.Int32)
member.summary: Given a binary integer value x, the next largest power of 2 can be computed by a SWAR algorithm that recursively "folds" the upper bits into the lower bits. This process yields a bit vector with the same most significant 1 as x, but all 1's below it. Adding 1 to that value yields the next largest power of 2.
member.param: The value for which the next largest power of 2 is needed
member.returns: The next largest power of 2 for x which is strictly more than x Note that for x = 32 the result is 64, not 32.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.BitHelper.BitAggregateMagic.IsPowerOfTwo(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Checks whether x is a power of two.
member.returns: true if x is a power of 2, false otherwise. (Note that 0 is a power of 2)

member.summary: The name of the metric used for pumping data for in the new (Monitoring Agent) pipeline.

member.summary: The name of the metric used for pumping data for in the new (Monitoring Agent) pipeline.
member.remarks: This is the metric contains configuration indicating whether , , etc.. are enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.DefaultSamplingTypes
member.summary: Gets the default configuration to be used, when the configuration is not obtained from server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.DefaultScalingFactorForMetrics
member.summary: The map of "special" strings in metric names to default scaling factors to be used when scaling factor is not configured for metrics.
member.remarks: The values for scaling factor in this list must be greater than or equal to zero.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.#ctor(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Single},Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SamplingTypes)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.MonitoringAccount
member.summary: Gets or sets the Monitoring Account to which this metric is reported.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.MetricNamespace
member.summary: Gets or sets the metric namespace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.MetricName
member.summary: Gets or sets the metric name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.SamplingTypes
member.summary: Gets the metric name and sampling types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.ScalingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor to be used.
member.remarks: Clients should pass un-scaled values when this is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.HyperLogLogBValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the collections of dimensions configured for Distinct count.
member.remarks: Each HyperLogLog counter uses a small, fixed amount of space but can estimate the cardinality of any set of up to around a billion values with relative error of 1.04 / Math.sqrt(2 ** b) with high probability.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.PreAggregationsWithDistinctCountColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the collections of dimensions configured for Distinct count.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.DimensionConfigurations
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of dimension configurations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.PreAggregations
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of pre-aggregates which this metric will be aggregated with.
member.remarks: We have hidden the configuration APIs. If we ever need to expose the configuration APIs, we need to revisit the types of properties. For this particular property, we can expose a strong-typed class named PreAggregateConfigurationList that can check for duplicate entries, or we can even make the whole configuration object read only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.ComputedSamplingTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed sampling types. In the case of , this field is used to save the expressions and their names.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.MetricIdentifiers
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of the variable names of metrics to the metric identifiers. The keys can be used in the field of the .
member.remarks: Used only for composite metrics. Composite metric cannot use of another composite metric as of now, so the UI should show hints appropriately.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.IsCompositeMetric
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the metric configuration is for a composite metric (i.e. one that is composed of multiple metrics).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.EnableClientSidePublication
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this event should be published by the metrics extension to any of the account defined endpoints.
member.remarks: If false, publication will not occur to the FE, but it will still be produced as a local aggregate on the client machine for Cosmos upload.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.EnableClientSideForking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this event should be published by the metrics extension to any of the external account endpoints.
member.remarks: If false, publication will still occur to the MDM primary endpoint but not to any of the external/forking endpoints.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.EnableClientSideEtwPublication
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this event should be published to the aggregated ETW provider.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.TreatMissingSeriesAsZeros
member.summary: Gets or sets whether metrics in composite metrics should be considered as zero when metric is not reported or is missing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.Configuration.MetricConfigurationV2.GetDefaultScalingFactor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the default scaling factor if contains scaling indicators.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1
member.summary: The interface used by deserializer to abstract the way how deserialized objects are created. It is up to the user of the deserializer to implement type to which data are deserialized, use object pools or not etc.
member.typeparam: Type of metadata to use for creation of metric data objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.SetSerializationVersion(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Sets the packet serialization version.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.CreateMetadata(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates the custom object representing metric metadata. Note that the same metadata object can be shared by many metric instances.
member.returns: The metric metadata representing the given parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.BeginMetricCreation
member.summary: Signals to the builder that it should get ready to start filling up data for a new metric.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.AssignMetadata(`0)
member.summary: Assigns metadata to the metric being built.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.AssignMonitoringAccount(System.String)
member.summary: Assigns a monitoring account to the metric being built. This is only called if the aggregated metric data was serialized with a version prior to v3. For v3 and above the monitoring account should be captured on the request itself, as part of the URL path or as a query parameter.
member.param: Monitoring account associated with the metric.
member.remarks: If we ever make this interface public we should check if there are no more clients submitting data prior to v3 and remove this method from the interface to avoid confusion from the users.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.AssignNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Assigns a namespace to the metric being built.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.AssignTimeUtc(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Assigns time (UTC) to the metric being built.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.AddDimensionValue(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the value of a single dimension to the metric being built. The dimension values are passed in the same order as the corresponding dimensions on the metric metadata.
member.param: Value of one dimension of the metric.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.AssignSamplingTypes(Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SamplingTypes)
member.summary: Assigns the sampling types of the metric being built.
member.param: Available sampling types of the metric.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.IMetricBuilder`1.AssignMin(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Assigns the minimum value of the metric being built.

member.summary: Class which deserializes Autopilot count (metric) data. Serialization format corresponds to one described in http://sharepoint/sites/autopilot/team/Docs/Silicon/Monitroing%20Team/AD%20Metrics%20%20Autopilot%20Counter%20Data%20Common%20Serialization%20Format.docx.
member.typeparam: Type of metadata object used for deserialization.

member.summary: Validates the data packet by CRC check

member.summary: Deserializes counter (metric) data from the stream and adds all objects to provided collection.
member.param: Stream from which data should be deserialized. Stream should be readable and provide randon access.
An object responsible for creation and further consumption of deserialized data.
Maximum length of strings, which represent metric name, dimension names and values.
Maximum length of metric namespace string.
Maximum length of metric dimension value string.

member.summary: Writes a histogram.
member.param: The number of buckets in histogram (must be equal to the number of elements in buckets collection).
A flag indicating whether histogram size (in bytes) should be put as a 4-bytes prefix in the beginning of the histogram data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.WriteHyperLogLogSketches(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.UInt32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.HyperLogLogSketch}})
member.summary: Writes collection of objects to a .
member.param: Collection of sketch dimension - sketch value pairs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.WriteHyperLogLogSketchesV2(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.UInt32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.HyperLogLogSketch}})
member.summary: Writes collection of objects to a .
member.param: Collection of sketch dimension - sketch value pairs.
member.remarks:
Will be replaced by V1 once deserialization code reaches everywhere.
HLL data is serialized in two format: Sparse HLL data format Version = 2 as byte BValue as byte For all non-zero elements : Position In Sketch(ushort), Value at that position(byte) Full HLL data format Version = 1 as byte BValue as byte For all elements : Value at that position(byte)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.EstimateUInt32InBase128Size(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Estimates a size in bytes of the uint value when written in Base-128.
member.param: Value which size has to be estimated.

member.summary: Reads int value stored in Base-128 encoding.
member.param: Binary reader to be used for reading.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.ReadInt64FromBase128(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads long value stored in Base-128 encoding.
member.param: Binary reader to be used for reading.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.ReadUInt32FromBase128(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads uint value stored in Base-128 encoding.
member.param: Binary reader to be used for reading.

member.summary: Reads uint value stored in Base-128 encoding.
member.param: Buffer from which value to be read.
Offset in buffer to start reading from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.ReadUInt64FromBase128(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads ulong value stored in Base-128 encoding.
member.param: Binary reader to be used for reading.

member.summary: Reads ulong value stored in Base-128 encoding.
member.param: Buffer from which value to be read.
Offset in buffer to start reading from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.ReadHistogram(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads a histogram.
member.param: Binary reader to be used for reading.
A flag indicating whether histogram data contains histogram size (in bytes) as a 4-bytes prefix.
member.returns: An enumerable of key values pairs where key is a sample value and value is a number of times the sample value appeared.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.ReadHyperLogLogSketch(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.HyperLogLogSketch})
member.summary: Assigns the hyperloglog sketches.
member.param: Stream reader containing the sketches data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.ReadHyperLogLogSketch(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Func{System.Int32,Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.HyperLogLogSketch},System.Int16@)
member.summary: Reads the hyperloglog sketch.
member.remarks: HLL data is serialized in three formats: Legacy HLL data format BValue as byte For all elements : Value at that position(byte) Sparse HLL data format Version = 2 as byte BValue as byte For all non-zero elements : Position In Sketch(ushort), Value at that position(byte) Full HLL data format Version = 1 as byte BValue as byte For all elements : Value at that position(byte)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.SerializationUtils.ReadFromStream(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads data from source stream and writes it to destination stream.

member.summary: An exception used to report about situation when version of deserializer doesn't support format of package it is used to deserialize.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Online.Metrics.Serialization.VersionNotSupportedMetricSerializationException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object.
member.param: A message explaining the cause for exception situation.
